#Text=John Fian
#Text=Dr. John Fian ( alias Cunninghame ) ( died 27 January 1591 ) was a Scottish schoolmaster in Prestonpans , East Lothian and purported sorcerer .
#Text=He confessed to have a compact with the devil while acting as register and scholar to several witches in North Berwick Kirk .

#Text=He was accused of bewitching townsfolk , preaching witchcraft , and , along with Agnes Sampson and others , raising storms to sink the fleet of King James VI of Scotland and his wife Anne of Denmark as they returned from their wedding celebrations in Oslo .
#Text=He along with several other witches were arrested , examined and put to torture , in what would become known as the North Berwick witch trials .
#Text=Background
#Text=As Fian taught in his school , a boy who studied with him was serving as a scholar .
#Text=Fian was very attracted to this boy 's sister and attempted to enchant the girl with a spell of seduction .
#Text=Her mother however was also a well practiced witch and sabotaged his enchantment to seduce a cow instead .
#Text=The inhabitants of the town later confessed that this cow followed him wherever he went . [ 1 ]
#Text=Apprehension
#Text=Illustration of Doctor Fian drawing conjuration circles with the bewitched cow , from the English pamphlet Newes from Scotland
#Text=His apprehension was caused by a confession from Gillis Duncan which afterward prompted his examinations as a sorcerer .
#Text=Fian first openly confessed that he bewitched a gentleman to fall into fits of lunacy once every 24 hours .

#Text=To verify this , Fian caused the same gentleman to come before the presence of King James in the king 's chamber on 24 December 1590 , where he purportedly bewitched the man , causing him to be in a hysterical fit for an entire hour of screaming , contorting and jumping high enough to touch the ceiling of the chamber ; after the hour ended , the gentleman declared no memory of the event , as if he were asleep . [ 2 ]
#Text=Fian confessed during a later trial examination that he made a compact with Satan but would renounce Satan and vow to lead the life of a Christian .

#Text=The next morning , he confessed that during the previous night , the Devil came to him in his cell dressed in all black with a white wand , demanding Fian to continue his faithful service , according to the first oath and promise of their agreement .

#Text=Fian testified that he renounced Satan to his face saying " Avoided Satan , avoided , for I have listened too much to thee , and by the same thou hast undone me , in respect whereof I utterly forsake you . "
#Text=He confessed that the devil then answered " That once ere thou die thou shall be mine . "
#Text=The devil afterwards broke the white wand , and immediately vanished from his sight .
#Text=He then was given a chance to lead the life he promised but the same night he stole a key to his cell and escaped .
#Text=He was eventually captured and tortured until his execution . [ 3 ]
#Text=Death

#Text=He endured the torture of having his fingernails forcibly extracted , then having iron pins thrust therein , the pilliwinks , and the boot to crush his feet until they were so small that they were no longer usable .
#Text=He was reported to have endured the torture without expressing pain .
#Text=He was finally taken to the Castlehill in Edinburgh , placed in a cart , strangled , and burnt on 27 January 1591 .
#Text=The cost of his execution was £5 18s 2d .
